author: R Vimal Kumar
text:
Farmers cultivating tapioca in the region are worried over the falling prices for the produce and looks up to the government for restriction in starch imports to help them get better prices.

“The price has come down now to almost Rs. 5,000 a tonne against Rs. 12,000 two years back due to a plethora of reasons,” said C. Nallasami, secretary of Tamil Nadu Agriculturists Associations.

The Union Government should impose an anti-dumping duty of 300 per cent so as restrict the imports of starch in large quantities and thereby, protect the livelihood of farmers here, he said. Starch is in demand for paper manufacturing industry, textile sector and for making of edible items. “Adulteration is also a big factor for the slump in the demand for tapioca. Unless the enforcement agencies take adequate steps, the tapioca farmers could face glut,” said Mr. Nallasami.
title: ‘Impose anti-dumping duty on starch’
